alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Morgan; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 11:57AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Morgan, northwestern Johnson, northwestern Magoffin, southeastern Rowan, central Wolfe and Elliott Counties through 1230 PM EST... At 1155 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Blairs Mills to Stillwater. Movement was northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fannin Valley, Lytten, Minor, Farley, Wagner, Little Sandy, Hamm and Blairs Mills around 1200 PM EST. Sandy Hook, Henry, Lewis, Stark, Newfoundland, Greear, Holliday, Lykins, Liberty Road and Woodsbend around 1205 PM EST. West Liberty, White Oak, Cottle, Bruin, Florress, Williams, Matthew, Gordon Ford, Well Station and Malone around 1210 PM EST. Dingus, Silverhill, Jeptha, Haleburg, Logville, Grayfox, Elamton, Orient, Ever and Elkfork around 1215 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Relief, Gillem Branch, Redbush, Elna, Keaton, Mima, Ophir, Moon, Win, Hargis, Barnrock, Winifred, Flatgap, Chandlerville, Sip and Kerz. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 45 and 63. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 14 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Elliott; Johnson; Magoffin; Morgan; Rowan; Wolfe
